reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Enhancing Resilience and Livelihood Opportunities for Affected Population through wheat value chain support and livelihood interventions in Idleb and Aleppo

description.narrative: The proposed project will achieve two goals: 1) Supporting the widows camps in addition to the most vulnerable populations (IDPs in Camps) in Idleb, Mahmbal, Maaret Tamsrin subdistricts in Idleb and Albaband Al Raee subdistricts in Aleppo. 2) Enhancing wheat value chain in two governorates (Idleb and Aleppo), and consequently enhancing food security in the target areas through inter-linked components. The project was built on achievements of the previous interventions of HIHFAD (irrigated farmland, a farmer association, agricultural inputs for the vulnerable households and free bread distributions) in the target areas. 8,590 HHs (45,668 individuals) in total will directly benefit from this project The project consists of five main components: 1) Supporting 400 vegetable farmers with supplementary irrigation costs (Using of diesel vouchers modality), access to irrigation channels located in the Al-Rouge plain, an area of 2 Donum of vegetable agricultural land will be supported for each farmer in addition to do a light rehabilitation to 10 km of the water canals which serving a 800 hectares of strategical agricultural lands in Alrouge plain area, the project engages cash for work scheme for the irrigation works. 2) Supporting the wheat value chain through purchasing wheat seeds from the local harvesting session, where the project is aiming to purchase 1230 MT from 1230 farmers (930 from Idleb and 300 from Aleppo). 3) Supporting 2720 farmers (2100 in Idleb and 620 in Aleppo) with agriculture inputs (wheat seeds purchased from the local farmers and supplementary irrigation) to support the wheat cultivation in the Al-Rouge plain in Idleb and Albab Subistrict in Aleppo. 4) Providing training on good agriculture practice, storing, marketing and strategic planning for 700 farmers and staff of the Farmers Associations in addition to members from the local entities at the area of Idleb and Aleppo as well. 5) Processing 465 MT of purchased wheat into 370 MT of wheat flour and distribute it as a fresh bread bundles (1 KG) over 3900 HHs using in kind modality, this component will target the widows’ camps at the targeted subdistricts in addition to the IDPs in camps for 6 months of distribution 26 days per month via contracting local bakeries, the wheat output of the milling and sieving will be used to cover the wheat milling cost into flour with about $ 13,950. HIHFAD will purchase a soap from Turkey and will distribute 700 G of soap for all of households of the BN. GAP sessions will train BNs regarding the appropriate and recommended dosage and amount of pesticide and fertilizer to make sure they have good results and benefits of them and decrease the negative impact on the environment. The project will clearly inform the selection criteria to the target communities, and let the communities understand that the vulnerable households are prioritized through the project, not only landowners. also, HIHFAD will build on the already existing beneficiary committee in Al Rouge plain and the agriculture offices in Albab Local council. The worker in all of CFW activities will be selected from the IDPs and HC in coordination with the field local authorities via public registration and according to a specific criteria: -Households with member/s with disabilities -Women headed household -The families with no income source -Age more than 18. -Have the capability to carry out such works. -Host families who are hosting IDPs where the selection criteria for the farmers will be: 1. Full access to land 2. Land size (in Dunum) between 5 to 10 Dunums for wheat and 2 Dunums for vegetables 3. Settled in the relevant location for a minimum of 6 months in case of IDP. 4. Previous experience in relevant crop farming. 5. Access to the irrigation system for the vegetables. 6. Agriculture is the main source of income for the household. the priority will be given to the vulnerable households from the applicant

owner-org.narrative: United Nations OCHA Financial Tracking Service (UN OCHA FTS)
